byline.contributor: Ana Vanessa Herrero reported from Caracas, and Elisabeth Malkin from Mexico City.
byline.original: By ANA VANESSA HERRERO and ELISABETH MALKIN

abstract: Hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans take to streets of Caracas and other cities to call for referendum on whether Pres Nicolas Maduro should be removed from office; opposition leaders warn they are planning 12-hour general strike to increase pressure on government.

headline.print_headline: Venezuelans Take to Streets to Put Pressure on President
headline.main: Venezuelans Take to Streets to Oppose President Nicolás Maduro

snippet: Hundreds of thousands of protesters in Caracas demanded a recall referendum that would expel the president from office....
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of thousands of protesters in Caracas demanded a recall referendum that would expel the president from office.
